snippet: With Adam LaRoche set to return to Washington, Michael Morse, a right-handed-hitting outfielder and first baseman, could be squeezed out. And he is the type of player the Yankees are in need of.
abstract: Washington Nationals reach two-year agreement to re-sign veteran first baseman Adam LaRoche, move that would most likely spring loose Michael Morse, outfielder, first baseman and right-handed hitter New York Yankees so covet; other MLB news noted.
lead_paragraph: With Adam LaRoche set to return to Washington, Michael Morse, a right-handed-hitting outfielder and first baseman, could be squeezed out. And he is the type of player the Yankees are in need of.

headline.seo: Nationals’ Michael Morse Moves Into Yankees’ Sights
headline.main: Nationals’ Morse Moves Into the Yankees’ Sights
headline.print_headline: Nationals’ Morse Moves Into the Yankees’ Sights
